title: Fishermen Take the Lead in Tackling Ocean Plastic Pollution - The Fishing Daily
summary: The article highlights an initiative led by Johnny Walsh in the fishing industry to collect ocean plastic using repurposed fishing nets and blockchain technology, aiming to remove up to 1,995,000 kilograms of ocean plastic annually.
green_innovation: TRUE - The initiative of collecting ocean plastic through repurposed fishing nets and blockchain technology contributes to environmental sustainability goals by addressing ocean plastic waste and promoting ocean health.
business_innovation: TRUE - The initiative undertaken by Johnny Walsh in the fishing industry to repurpose fishing nets, use blockchain technology, and commit to removing ocean plastic can be considered a business innovation as it represents a new approach in the industry towards sustainability and social responsibility.
green_product: TRUE - The utilization of repurposed fishing nets, sustainable practices, and the commitment to removing ocean plastic by the fishing company align with the characteristics of a green product as it significantly reduces environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE - The method of repurposing fishing nets, using blockchain technology for transparent tracking, and committing to removing ocean plastic demonstrates a green process as it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability in the fishing industry.
product_or_process: Ocean plastic collection using repurposed fishing nets and blockchain technology
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 114112 - Shellfish Fishing, 562119 - Other Waste Collection, 541511 - Custom Computer Programming Services, 551112 - Offices of Other Holding Companies
greenwashing: FALSE - The initiative described in the article does not seem to be an example of greenwashing as it involves concrete actions to address ocean plastic waste and improve environmental sustainability.

title: Dr. Saeeda Jaffar, senior VP & group country manager, Visa GCC - Economy Middle East
summary: The article discusses the rise of contactless payment solutions and sustainable finance, highlighting Visa's initiatives in the GCC region to promote green and digital innovations.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article primarily focuses on financial technology, payment solutions, and financial inclusion rather than innovations directly aimed at reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article highlights new financial technologies, payment methods, and tailored solutions introduced by Visa, showcasing business innovations in the finance sector.
green_product: FALSE. The article predominantly emphasizes digital payment solutions and financial tools rather than goods or services designed to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article primarily discusses financial technologies, digital payments, and banking solutions rather than methods in manufacturing or production aimed at minimizing environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 522320 - Financial Transactions Processing, Reserve, and Clearing House Activities, 522210 - Credit Card Issuing, 511210 - Software Publishers, 523999 - Miscellaneous Financial Investment Activities
greenwashing: FALSE. The article is focused on showcasing Visa's genuine efforts towards sustainable finance, green payments, and financial inclusion, rather than making false or exaggerated claims about environmental benefits.
